purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of general model parameters. A general model parameter is an input, output, or both, related to a model of some functionality, simulation or analysis.

inscope.li: the representation of a general model parameter
the representation of the default value of the parameter

outscope.li: relating a general model parameter to a model
the representation of the actual value of the general model parameter for input or output

definition.def:
indicates that parameter values are passed into the model and is signified using the following UML 2 URI
http://schema.omg.org/spec/UML2.1/ParemeterDirectionKind-in

indicates that parameter values are passed from a model and is signified using the following UML 2 URI
http://schema.omg.org/spec/UML2.1/ParemeterDirectionKind-out

indicates that parameter values are passed into a model and then back out from the model and is signified using the following UML 2 URI
http://schema.omg.org/spec/UML2.1/ParemeterDirectionKind-inout

indicates that parameter values are passed as return values from a model and is signified using the following UML 2 URI
http://schema.omg.org/spec/UML2.1/ParemeterDirectionKind-return

usage_guide.p: Implementations of this part of ISO 10303 make use of the capability to classify a general model parameter in order to specify the direction of general model parameter being represented. For the purpose of specifying the direction of the general model parameter, the OMG UML 2.1 concept of ParameterDirectionKind has been adopted. The terms in, out, inout and return are defined in this part of ISO 10303 and represent the same concepts from the UML 2.1 specification regarding ParameterDirectionKind and are referenced using the specified URIs (see 3.5).
